**Brimstone Fiends** are truly brutal demons, even among other [greater demons](/Tier-1_demon "Tier-1 demon"). Like all [Fiends](/Fiend "Fiend"), they are capable of [tormenting](/Torment "Torment") victims, and their powerful Damnation attacks make them a threat even to prepared adventurers. They are immune to most [fire](/Fire "Fire") attacks, but are vulnerable to [cold](/Cold "Cold"). Brimstone Fiends can be found in [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna") and [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"), and may be summoned by [liches](/Lich "Lich"), demon lords, and other powerful casters.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                             |                                                      |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Hurl Damnation](/Hurl_Damnation "Hurl Damnation") (3d20)   | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- All fiends are very dangerous; their combination of torment and high-powered attacks can lead to a very quick death. The Brimstone Fiend is one of the more dangerous members of this family, especially at range. Use cold spells, or a [freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")- or [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath")-[branded](/Brand "Brand") weapon (the latter is more effective), to take it out as quickly as possible.
- If you lack ranged abilities, lure it around a corner into melee rather than risking several turns of torment and damnation. Its melee attacks hurt a lot less than its spells.
- If you are undead or in [lichform](/Lichform "Lichform"), the Brimstone Fiend will forego torment and just cast Damnation. Damnation never misses and ignores AC, making it very deadly, especially for low-HP characters such as [deep elves](/Deep_elves "Deep elves"), [felids](/Felid "Felid"), or casters who haven't built up their [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting") skill.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), they were [vulnerable to water](/Category:Water_vulnerability "Category:Water vulnerability").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), you could summon your own Brimstone Fiend with the [Summon Greater Demon](/Summon_Greater_Demon "Summon Greater Demon") spell. Its loyalty was not guaranteed, however.
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), "Brimstone Fiends" were named "Fiends."

Brimstone Fiends are truly brutal demons, even among other greater demons. They are immune to most fire attacks, but are vulnerable to cold. Brimstone Fiends can be found in Gehenna and Pandemonium, and may be summoned by liches, demon lords, and other powerful casters.

Use cold spells, or a freezing- or holy wrath-branded weapon (the latter is more effective), to take it out as quickly as possible.
  • If you lack ranged abilities, lure it around a corner into melee rather than risking several turns of torment and damnation. Its melee attacks hurt a lot less than its spells.
